story.text: From work to our personal lives, how do we agree on where (our) boundaries are? What is consent? How does it differ from other forms of decision making? And what do you need to make it work?
Vincent van der Lubbe, Chair of Sociocracy for All, will guide you through the logical steps of consent, help you experiment with how they can work and what challenges lie ahead.

# Concepts
The workshop explores the following concepts:

- [[What is democracy?]]

The Age of Consent - Decision Making for Now

Afternoon Day 1, Saturday 25th October
Start: 15:55  -  End: 16:20

Vincent van der Lubbe
Chair Sociocracy for All / Hansei Consulting
The following 25 min workshop will take place during the networking break (15:55 - 16:20).

Introduction to Lexon

TIME 15:55
FOR 25 min
IN Europe/Paris
For those interested, consider staying for a more in-depth (70 min) workshop. hands-on experience (16:20 - 17:30).

# Workshops ## Day 1 - Friday October 25th | | | | ------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | XX:XX - YY-YY | ## The Age of Consent - Decision Making for Now
- *Vincent van der Lubbe (Chair Sociocracy for All / Hansei Consulting)*

**#whatisdemocracy**

From work to our personal lives, how do we agree on where (our) boundaries are? What is consent? How does it differ from other forms of decision making? And what do you need to make it work? Vincent van der Lubbe, Chair of Sociocracy for All, will guide you through the logical steps of consent, help you experiment with how they can work and what challenges lie ahead. | | XX:XX - YY-YY | ## Title
- *Henning Diedrich (Founder, Lexon)*

**#futurelaw**
What is a smart contract, and how can we democratise the process of creating the laws and code that govern our every day lives in an increasingly technologically driven society? Henning Diedrich, the founder of Lexon introduces a new way to code smart contracts. Using natural language processing, Lexon enables, non-coders, lawyers, philosophers, hackers and students of the future to create decentralised code (smart contracts) on the blockchain. | | XX:XX - YY-YY | ?????????????? | ## Day 2 - Saturday October 26th | XX:XX - YY-YY | ## Un mundo sin intermediarios, un mundo P2P
- *Philipe Domínguez (Open Source developer)*

**#republicofscience #openinnovation**

Cómo montar una tienda en Bitcoin y tener un monedero de Bitcoin exclusivamente con Software libre.

Proponemos un taller introductorio a Bitcoin y a su uso concreto para el comercio electrónico. Se presentará una solución completa para vender, almacenar monedas y protegerlas. Para ello se presentarán 4 herramientas que describiremos aquí debajo, pero claramente demuestran la posibilidad desde hoy mismo, de imaginarse un modelo de intercambio basado en el P2P, desde la venta (intercambio) hasta el almacenamiento de valor.

Basándonos en herramientas exclusivamente de Software libre, para una máxima confianza y seguridad, planteamos un workflow que ya ha hecho sus pruebas en cuanto a calidad, pero que sobre todo demuestra que no hablamos de utopía sino de una realidad que tardará mas o menos en llegar al conjunto de los ciudadanos del mundo. Hoy es igual de fácil de intercambiar con la gente del barrio como con quien este en el otro hemisferio.

Te proponemos anticipar la sociedad y economía P2P del futuro, pero hoy mismo.

https://mensuel.framapad.org/p/charlita?lang=fr | | ------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | XX:XX - YY-YY | ## Scriptwriting
- *Jean-Pierre Bekolo* *(**Director -& Producer / JEAN PIERRE BEKOLO SARL)*

**#imagine**
Throughout human history, stories have been central to our existence, the signal within the noise, recognisable patterns in which we find meaning and give sense to our world. The power of stories What make us human If stories themselves are universal, the way we tell them changes with the technology at hand and every new medium has given rise to new forms of narrative. With the arrival of the internet, our stories broke loose from their linear boundaries, becoming hyperlinked storylines, delivered in mutable and complex formats (audio, video and text). An open communication channel where participation is not only possible but expected and collective imagination can reach its full potential. | | XX:XX - YY-YY | ## **Open Innovation**
- *Alex Shkor (Founder, DEIP)*

**#republicofscience #openinnovation**
When we think of innovation, we think of a lone inventor in a garage. Possibly a researcher working at a university, or perhaps the research activities undertaken by a private company. That is we think of something that happens within a bounded space, that is the bounds of an individual legal person. |
## Day 1 - Friday October 25th

## The Age of Consent - Decision Making for Now
- *Vincent van der Lubbe (Chair Sociocracy for All / Hansei Consulting)*
**#whatisdemocracy**

## The Age of Consent - Decision Making for Now
- *Vincent van der Lubbe (Chair Sociocracy for All / Hansei Consulting)*
**#whatisdemocracy**

From work to our personal lives, how do we agree on where (our) boundaries are? What is consent? How does it differ from other forms of decision making? And what do you need to make it work? Vincent van der Lubbe, Chair of Sociocracy for All, will guide you through the logical steps of consent, help you experiment with how they can work and what challenges lie ahead.
## Titl
*Henning Diedrich (Founder, Lexon)*
**#futurelaw**
What is a smart contract, and how can we democratise the process of creating the laws and code that govern our every day lives in an increasingly technologically driven society?

Henning Diedrich, the founder of Lexon introduces a new way to code smart contracts. Using natural language processing, Lexon enables, non-coders, lawyers, philosophers, hackers and students of the future to create decentralised code (smart contracts) on the blockchain.

## Day 2 - Saturday October 26th | XX:XX - YY-YY | ## Un mundo sin intermediarios, un mundo P2P
- *Philipe Domínguez (Open Source developer)*

**#republicofscience #openinnovation**

Cómo montar una tienda en Bitcoin y tener un monedero de Bitcoin exclusivamente con Software libre.

Proponemos un taller introductorio a Bitcoin y a su uso concreto para el comercio electrónico. Se presentará una solución completa para vender, almacenar monedas y protegerlas. Para ello se presentarán 4 herramientas que describiremos aquí debajo, pero claramente demuestran la posibilidad desde hoy mismo, de imaginarse un modelo de intercambio basado en el P2P, desde la venta (intercambio) hasta el almacenamiento de valor.

Basándonos en herramientas exclusivamente de Software libre, para una máxima confianza y seguridad, planteamos un workflow que ya ha hecho sus pruebas en cuanto a calidad, pero que sobre todo demuestra que no hablamos de utopía sino de una realidad que tardará mas o menos en llegar al conjunto de los ciudadanos del mundo. Hoy es igual de fácil de intercambiar con la gente del barrio como con quien este en el otro hemisferio.

Te proponemos anticipar la sociedad y economía P2P del futuro, pero hoy mismo.

- *Jean-Pierre Bekolo* *(**Director -& Producer / JEAN PIERRE BEKOLO SARL)*

**#imagine**
Throughout human history, stories have been central to our existence, the signal within the noise, recognisable patterns in which we find meaning and give sense to our world. The power of stories What make us human If stories themselves are universal, the way we tell them changes with the technology at hand and every new medium has given rise to new forms of narrative. With the arrival of the internet, our stories broke loose from their linear boundaries, becoming hyperlinked storylines, delivered in mutable and complex formats (audio, video and text). An open communication channel where participation is not only possible but expected and collective imagination can reach its full potential. | | XX:XX - YY-YY | ## **Open Innovation**
- *Alex Shkor (Founder, DEIP)*

**#republicofscience #openinnovation**
When we think of innovation, we think of a lone inventor in a garage. Possibly a researcher working at a university, or perhaps the research activities undertaken by a private company. That is we think of something that happens within a bounded space, that is the bounds of an individual legal person. |
